summary: The Supplemental Oxygen Access Reform Act of 2025 (SOAR Act) aims to improve Medicare coverage and access to supplemental oxygen therapy. Key provisions include removing oxygen and related equipment from the competitive acquisition program, establishing new payment methodologies for oxygen services (including liquid oxygen), defining supplier responsibilities, expanding the definition of "medical and other health services" to include respiratory therapist services, requiring electronic templates for medical necessity documentation, establishing notice requirements for beneficiaries regarding cost-sharing and rights, and outlining comprehensive beneficiary protections. The bill seeks to ensure adequate access and quality of care for those reliant on supplemental oxygen.
